What Are The Disadvantages Of Using Non-Linear Epi To T1 Coregistration For Fmri Analysis?
Traditionally to bring results from individual subject to common space one would coregister subject specific mean EPI image to subject specific T1 image coregister subject specific T1 image to a template Step 1 has been usually done with rigid body, or affine transformation sometimes with the use of boundaries extracted from the T1 image. However, EPI images often suffer from geometric distortion

What are the disadvantages of using non-linear EPI to T1 coregistration for fMRI analysis?
Traditionally to bring results from individual subject to common space one would coregister subject specific mean EPI image to subject specific T1 image coregister subject specific T1 image to a template Step 1 has been usually done with rigid body, or affine transformation sometimes with the use of boundaries extracted from the T1 image. However, EPI images often suffer from geometric distortion
